thread.title: Djokovic beats Murray 2-0 at Shanghai Masters
thread.title_full: Djokovic beats Murray 2-0 at Shanghai Masters

title: Djokovic beats Murray 2-0 at Shanghai Masters
text:
Djokovic beats Murray 2-0 at Shanghai Masters 
CCTV.com Share this: Share on twitter Share on facebook Share on sinaweibo Share on email Font size: 
Novak Djokovic continues his stellar play in China. Last week, the world number one captured the China Open in Beijing - improving to 29-and-oh in the Chinese capital. And he used that momentum in Shanghai at the Masters as he rolled into the final after humiliating world number two Andy Murray in just 67 minutes. The world number one would put pressure on the Murray serve from the outset -- and unforced errors did not help the Scot as he fires this long -- as Djoker would break to go in front 2-1.Djoker was ruthless in the opener -- showing incredible court coverage at the net and easily puts away this volley as he grabs a 5-1 lead.The world number two made 17 unforced errors in the opener, including this on set point -- as Djokovic cruises to a 6-1 victory.Murray would start better in the next frame -- breaking the world number one.But Djokovic broke straight back, as he shows off his incredible defensive skills and winning it with a volley at the net to tie things at a game all.The Serb would then start to be on cruise control, getting another break -- and then using his heavy serve to set up a winner at the net -- as he is two games from victory.And the world number one would seal victory with a heavy backhand winner that Murray can't reach - Djoker wins it 6-1, 6-3 to make it to the final in Shanghai and improves to 20-and-9 all-time against the Scot. Frenchman grabs 6-4, 0-6, 7-5 victory to make Final The other semi-final had Jo-Wilfried Tsonga facing Rafa Nadal, and the Frenchman gets an early break thanks to a sizzling winner inside the line.Rafa would show off his skills in the next game, as this lariat forehand goes cross-court for a winner.The Frenchman's big serve got him out of trouble and smashes this home to stay in front, en route to a 6-4 opening set win.Nadal would be on form in the second set -- the overhead is too much for the Jo-Willy to handle. The former number one, was in a zone in the next frame -- as he whips this forrehand cross-court for a win as he takes the set at Love. The third set went on serve until the 11th game -- when Nadal can't get this ball over the net -- and he he knows he may have handed the match to Tsonga.Next game -- and the point of the match -- Jo-Willy is two points from victory but nadal will not give in -- chaseing down the drop shot -- and then retreating to the baseline. But Tsonga is there at the net to poke it over -- and is a point away from the win.And the 16th seed would go out a winner, when Rafa's return is dumped into the net. Tsonga wins it 6-4, 0-6, 7-5 in two hours and 15 minutes -- and meets Djokovic in the final. Related Videos
